title: Kanthanawit Js
text:

 Art by Allison Horst. Be sure to check out the rest of Allison‚Äôs seriously cute Quarto penguin art in the #rstudioconf2022 keynote talk, Hello Quarto, by Julie Lowndes & Mine √áetinkaya-Rundel!
‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏´‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏ú‡∏π‡πâ‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡∏£‡∏π‡πâ‡∏à‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ö RMarkdown ‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡∏£‡∏ß‡∏ö‡πÄ‡∏ô‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏´‡∏≤(‡∏ï‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏á‡∏™‡∏∑‡∏≠) code ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞ output ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞ ‡∏£‡∏ß‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏Å‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤ ‚Äúknitted‚Äù documents ‡πÅ‡∏ï‡πà Quarto ‡∏ó‡∏≥‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ô RMarkdown ‡πÅ‡∏ï‡πà‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏Å‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤ ‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á ‡∏¢‡∏±‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏†‡∏≤‡∏©‡∏≤‡∏≠‡∏∑‡πà‡∏ô ‡πÜ ‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ

metadata ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞ configurations ‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏π‡πà‡πÉ‡∏ô‡πÑ‡∏ü‡∏•‡πå YAML (‡∏ï‡∏≤‡∏° --- ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏π‡πà‡∏ö‡∏ô‡∏ö‡∏ô‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏£)
‡πÇ‡∏Ñ‡πâ‡∏î ‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏π‡πà‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏™‡πà‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏Å‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤ code chunks
‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏´‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö ‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡πÅ‡∏•‡πâ‡∏ß ‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏≠‡∏¢‡∏π‡πà‡πÉ‡∏ô
```{r}

```

They also look pretty similar when knitted/rendered. Below is a side-by-side comparison of a knitted .rmd file and a rendered .qmd file (both as .html files):

‡∏ö‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ‡πÅ‡∏õ‡∏•‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏ö‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ô‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢ Sam clicks ‡∏≠‡∏ò‡∏¥‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏¢ Quarto ‡∏ã‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏≠‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏∂‡∏á workflow ‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏´‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏™‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏õ‡πÑ‡∏ã‡∏ó‡πå ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏ß‡∏õ‡πÑ‡∏ã‡∏ó‡πå ‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏•‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏î ‡∏ö‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ ‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡πÅ‡∏õ‡∏•‡πÅ‡∏•‡πâ‡∏ß ‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏≠‡∏ò‡∏¥‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏ï‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡πÉ‡∏à‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏≥‡∏ï‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏à‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏á
‡∏ö‡∏ó‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏ä‡∏ß‡∏ô‡∏≠‡πà‡∏≤‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏¥‡πà‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏° ‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡πÉ‡∏´‡πâ‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡πÉ‡∏à‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏Ç‡∏∂‡πâ‡∏ô

title: ‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ DMRT ‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏ñ‡∏π‡∏Å‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á
text:
DMRT ‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏°‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏ñ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≠‡πÑ‡∏õ‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ

‡πÄ‡∏°‡∏∑‡πà‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ö‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ö‡∏Ñ‡πà‡∏≤‡πÄ‡∏â‡∏•‡∏µ‡πà‡∏¢‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏∏‡πà‡∏°‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏¥‡∏™‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ô ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡πà‡∏ô ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡πÄ‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ö‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏ö‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ï‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß 3 ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ò‡∏∏‡πå

‡∏ï‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏Ñ‡πâ‡∏î R: ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏π‡∏•‡πÇ‡∏Ñ‡πâ‡∏î

#‡∏™‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏π‡∏•‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ï‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß 3 ‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ò‡∏∏‡πå
yield <- c(10, 12, 11, 13, 14, 12, 15, 16, 14, 17, 18, 16)
variety <- factor(rep(c("A", "B", "C"), each = 4))
data <- data.frame(yield, variety)
# ‡∏ó‡∏≥ ANOVA
model <- aov(yield ~ variety, data = data)
summary(model)

            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)   
variety      2   45.5   22.75     9.1 0.00689 **
Residuals    9   22.5    2.50                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

# ‡∏ó‡∏≥ DMRT
library(agricolae)
duncan.test(model, "variety", console = TRUE)


Study: model ~ "variety"

Duncan's new multiple range test
for yield 

Mean Square Error:  2.5 

variety,  means

  yield      std r        se Min Max   Q25  Q50   Q75
A 11.50 1.290994 4 0.7905694  10  13 10.75 11.5 12.25
B 14.25 1.707825 4 0.7905694  12  16 13.50 14.5 15.25
C 16.25 1.707825 4 0.7905694  14  18 15.50 16.5 17.25

Alpha: 0.05 ; DF Error: 9 

Critical Range
       2        3 
2.529169 2.639820 

Means with the same letter are not significantly different.

  yield groups
C 16.25      a
B 14.25      a
A 11.50      b

title: ‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ DMRT ‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏ñ‡∏π‡∏Å‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á
text:
DMRT ‡πÑ‡∏°‡πà‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏°‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏™‡∏ñ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≠‡πÑ‡∏õ‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ
‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏î‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏ö‡∏ö‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏• ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏î‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏ö‡∏ö‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏• ‡∏Ñ‡∏∑‡∏≠ ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏î‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏®‡∏∂‡∏Å‡∏©‡∏≤‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏õ‡∏±‡∏à‡∏à‡∏±‡∏¢‡∏ï‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏ï‡πà 2 ‡∏õ‡∏±‡∏à‡∏à‡∏±‡∏¢‡∏Ç‡∏∂‡πâ‡∏ô‡πÑ‡∏õ‡∏û‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ô DMRT ‡πÑ‡∏°‡πà‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ñ‡∏ß‡∏¥‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏∞‡∏´‡πå Interaction effect ‡∏´‡∏£‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏£‡πà‡∏ß‡∏°‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏õ‡∏±‡∏à‡∏à‡∏±‡∏¢‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ ‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏£‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ‡∏ß‡∏¥‡∏ò‡∏µ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ß‡∏¥‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏∞‡∏´‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏≤‡∏°‡πÅ‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏ß‡∏ô (ANOVA) ‡∏£‡πà‡∏ß‡∏°‡∏Å‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏î‡∏™‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏≠‡∏∑‡πà‡∏ô‡πÜ ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏° ‡πÄ‡∏ä‡πà‡∏ô Tukey‚Äôs HSD
‡∏ï‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πà‡∏≤‡∏á‡πÇ‡∏Ñ‡πâ‡∏î R:
‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏π‡∏•‡πÇ‡∏Ñ‡πâ‡∏î

# ‡∏™‡∏£‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏á‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏°‡∏π‡∏•‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏ú‡∏•‡∏¥‡∏ï‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ß‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏î‡∏•‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏ö‡∏ö‡πÅ‡∏ü‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏• (‡∏õ‡∏∏‡πã‡∏¢ 2 ‡∏ä‡∏ô‡∏¥‡∏î, ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏î‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≥ 2 ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏î‡∏±‡∏ö) 
yield <- c(10, 12, 14, 16, 12, 14, 16, 18) 
fertilizer <- factor(rep(c("A", "B"), each = 4)) 
water <- factor(rep(c("Low", "High"), times = 2)) 
data <- data.frame(yield, fertilizer, water)  
# ‡∏ó‡∏≥ Two-Way ANOVA 
model <- aov(yield ~ fertilizer * water, data = data) 
summary(model)  

                 Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)
fertilizer        1      8       8       1  0.374
water             1      8       8       1  0.374
fertilizer:water  1      0       0       0  1.000
Residuals         4     32       8               

# ‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏û‡∏ö Interaction effect  ‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏£‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ Tukey's HSD   
library(agricolae) 
# ‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏û‡∏ö Interaction effect ‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏£‡πÉ‡∏ä‡πâ TukeyHSD()
TukeyHSD(model) 

  Tukey multiple comparisons of means
    95% family-wise confidence level

Fit: aov(formula = yield ~ fertilizer * water, data = data)

$fertilizer
    diff       lwr      upr     p adj
B-A    2 -3.552914 7.552914 0.3739012

$water
         diff       lwr      upr     p adj
Low-High   -2 -7.552914 3.552914 0.3739012

$`fertilizer:water`
              diff        lwr       upr     p adj
B:High-A:High    2  -9.514117 13.514117 0.8895896
A:Low-A:High    -2 -13.514117  9.514117 0.8895896
B:Low-A:High     0 -11.514117 11.514117 1.0000000
A:Low-B:High    -4 -15.514117  7.514117 0.5528666
B:Low-B:High    -2 -13.514117  9.514117 0.8895896
B:Low-A:Low      2  -9.514117 13.514117 0.8895896

title: R here
text:
data viz

from Data to Viz, a choose-your-adventure-type experience for creating your best data visualizations
The Sessions College Color Calculator, for creating color palettes

title: R here
text:
reporting & presentations

Quarto is all the rage these days (and by these days, I mean post-March 2022). Download and find some great tutorials here to get started
Meet xaringan: Making slides in R Markdown, by Allison Hill
Sharing Your xaringan Slides, by Garrick Aden-Buie

title: R here
text:
learning materials

Ever feel like you need a pick-me-up while learning stats or a new R tool? Look no further than Allison Horst‚Äôs Data Science Illustrations, featuring the cutest and most educational fuzzy monsters you‚Äôll ever see!
Mastering Shiny, by Hadley Wickham
Happy Git and GitHub for the useR, by Jenny Bryan
R for Data Science, by Hadley Wickham
W3Schools, particularly for their HTML & CSS tutorials

title: R here
text:
data science communities
While these groups are primarily based in SoCal/Santa Barbara, there are tons of awesome groups like these all over the world. Google around to see what‚Äôs near you!

R-Ladies Santa Barbara and R-Ladies Global, which work to promote gender diversity in the R community
EcoDataScience, an environmental data science study group at UCSB

Southern California R Users, an alliance of R user groups in Southern California

Santa Barbara Women in STEM, while not specifically data science-focused, this group holds some really great career and networking events, panels, flash talks, and more

title: R here
text:
web accessibility

The A11Y Project is a community-driven effort to make digital content more accessible. I still have a long way to go in making my own website WCAG compliant ‚Äì the A11Y Project not only has a ton of great blog posts, but also WCAG compliance checklist that I will definitely be returning to over and over again.
Coblis, a color blindness simulator ‚Äì just upload a file and view your color palettes as they would appear under different types of color deficiencies

title: R here
text:
misc

Discover new music to jam out to while you hack at Every Noise at Once (HT: Jeanette Clark)
